title: Tom Jones and Rob Brydon host One Big Night for BBC Children In Need
text:
Tom Jones and Rob Brydon host One Big Night for BBC Children In Need Tom Jones and Rob Brydon host One Big Night for BBC Children In Need 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
A host of stars have joined Sir Tom Jones, Rob Brydon and Pudsey Bear for an evening of fundraising for BBC Children In Need. 
5 Seconds Of Summer, Laura Mvula, James Morrison, country duo The Shires and Scottish percussionist Dame Evelyn Glennie performed alongside Sir Tom and his band on stage. Rob Brydon and Sir Tom Jones (BBC) 
Brydon interspersed the evening with comedy sketches depicting some of the lively moments from Sir Tom’s illustrious career, featuring a cameo from Jessica Hynes. 5 Seconds Of Summer (BBC) 
Sir Tom said: “After months of planning, this evening of music and entertainment finally came together, and it truly was spectacular. The music is a joy and I got to perform alongside some absolutely amazing artists and see my career brought to life by some of Britain’s best loved comedians. The Shires (BBC) 
“It was great fun watching Rob and his friends having a few laughs at my expense! It really was a special night in aid of a very special charity. I hope everyone that came along enjoyed the evening, and I hope people tune in in November to see the show for themselves.” Jessica Hynes (BBC) 
BBC’s Children In Need supports around 2,500 projects in the UK that work with children facing a range of disadvantages, including poverty, abuse and disability. James Morrison (BBC) 
Children from one of those projects, Chickenshed Theatre, a theatre company that promotes social change and diversity, also joined Sir Tom and The Shires on stage for a song. Thank you to the children from @CHICKENSHED_UK for singing on stage with @theshiresuk & @RealSirTomJones ! pic.twitter.com/3C1wmtScQl 
— BBC Children in Need (@BBCCiN) October 8, 2015 
The concert was filmed and will be shown on BBC One in the week leading up to the BBC Children In Need Appeal night, which is scheduled for Friday November 13. Share article
